Annotation.note:
The Butterfly Theorem : Let $A,B,C,D$ be four points on a circle with center $O$, $P$ the intersection point of $AC$ and $BD$ and $F$ resp. $G$ the intersection point of the line through $P$ perpendicular to $OP$ with $AB$ resp. $CD$. Then $P$ is the midpoint of $FG$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
